info.name: Recipe_API
info.description: # ðŸš€ Get started here This API provides the main requests regarding recipes. ## ðŸ”– Authentication To use authentication during testing you may create your own OAuth Token based on the following steps: #### **Step 1: Get your access-token** - Go to Google Developers Console -> OAuth 2.0 Playground: [https://developers.google.com/oauthplayground/](https://developers.google.com/oauthplayground/) - Select OAuth2 API v2 (check email and profile as well) - Before clicking on Authorize APIs option ensure that the token will be created based on a common Client ID and Client secret. You may specify this clicking on the settings icon (on the right, see Image 3.) - OAuth Client ID: 162589133748-qjgufs6rv44fcrt4q8dstre6v1elo4cs.apps.googleusercontent.com - OAuth Client secret: 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 - Click on **Exchange authorization code for tokens option ->** you may get your own acces-token. During testing you may use the value of the **id_token**. #### **Step 2: Check token validity** You may check if the provided id-token is valid here: [https://oauth2.googleapis.com/tokeninfo?id_token=](https://oauth2.googleapis.com/tokeninfo?id_token=eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IjI4YTQyMWNhZmJlM2RkODg5MjcxZGY5MDBmNGJiZjE2ZGI1YzI0ZDQiLCJ0eXAiOiJKV1QifQ..jkbw3pkfN67UUqvpfczLktoNVaukuCNDRATYx_VX16moqn7F1mm1Ccoy8Ja5RkGGr_ayvAwB2LeRBHYg6IYCFut5f7qNIa1a31Wx5IhpjkAUqY23AuIE7UQ3hscpyiHwfc_3TlQVhP5vmMU-4sdofRnCbwmDYG7STLk8lbbaw70ppWoKvDRxLYNSV1ZVgsMrHdjkjOkyiVdCjfSg7erSZWYp5xn-WmOtRyedBfK9nEwwwUe0HZwRW492rXX8RaitcVN6UF6jO8ALt0c5PYs0TqvgsvRysW7GP89hxhw241LTtmfPfW1PDp6svBwK2Q8koxxWqy9AUuUZ3dpKSObf-Q) #### **Step 3: Try out the API endpoints using the provided Postman collection**

request.description: This GET request is used to "get" recipe data from an endpoint. There is no request body for this GET request. A successful GET response will have a `200 OK` status, and includes an array of recipes or empty array if there are no visible public recipes. There are two main categories in case of this request: guest mode and authenticated user. In guest mode, all public recipes will be shown, while in case of an authenticated user (you should provide the Bearer Token) all public recipes + the user's own recipes as well (see Image 1.).

request.description: This GET request is used to get more details of a specific recipe. There is no request body for this GET request. A successful GET response will have a `200 OK` status, and the details of a recipe in JSON format. In case of a personal recipe you should add the token as well using the Authorization tab.

response.name: GetRecipeDetail-wrong-recipe-id
response.body:
{
    "type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc9110#section-15.5.2",
    "title": "Bad Request",
    "status": 400,
    "detail": "Recipe ID in the URL does not match the recipe ID in the request body.",
    "instance": "/api/recipes/5"
}

request.description: This is a POST request, submitting data to an API via the request body. This request submits JSON data (all important information about a recipe), and the data is reflected in the response. A successful POST request typically returns a `200 OK` or `201 Created` response code. In order to be able to add a new recipe providing a valid token is inevitable, otherwise it should result in a 401 Unauthorized error.

response.name: AddRecipe-example

request.description:
This is a PUT request and it is used to overwrite an existing piece of recipe data. For instance, after you create a new recipe entity with a POST request, you may want to modify that later. You can do that using this PUT request. You need to identify the entity being updated by including an identifier in the URL (eg. `4`).

A successful PUT request will result in `204 No content` response code.

This is a DELETE request, and it is used to delete recipe data that was previously created via a POST request. You typically identify the entity being updated by including an identifier in the URL (eg. 5).

A successful DELETE request will result in `204 No Content` response code.

response.name: Delete data - Unauthorized
response.body:
{
    "type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc9110#section-15.5.1",
    "title": "Unauthorized",
    "status": 401,
    "detail": "You are not authorized to access the resource with ID 5.",
    "instance": "/api/recipes/5"
}

request.description: Using this GET request you may get your own recipes. Providing a valid token is necesarry.
